column3: Birth or Robert Christian Hansen, Esterville, Iowa. Left handed, parents tried to force him to become right handed; stuttered
column4: Birth or Robert Christian Hansen, Esterville, Iowa. Left handed, parents tried to force him to become right handed; stuttered

column3: Returned to Iowa from California; father strict disciplinarian, authoritarian; worked in father’s bakery at an early age (paid 35/45 cents to $1 per day)
column4: Returned to Iowa from California; father strict disciplinarian, authoritarian; worked in father’s bakery at an early age (paid 35/45 cents to $1 per day)

column3: Junior High School, humiliated in school b/c of stuttering, girls teased him, hated school, rejection by classmates made him feel inadequate
column4: Junior High School, humiliated in school b/c of stuttering, girls teased him, hated school, rejection by classmates made him feel inadequate

column3: High school, workload in family business, strict religious parents and little money prevented him from participating in social activities. Loner. Participated in boy’s chorus, pep club, driver’s ed., typing. Participated in basketball, didn’t letter. Letters in track- long distance and broad jump. Enjoyed solitary activities- hunting, fishing, and archery.
column4: High school, workload in family business, strict religious parents and little money prevented him from participating in social activities. Loner. Enjoyed solitary activities- hunting, fishing, and archery.

column3: Graduated from high school in a class of 31. Name misspelled in yearbook.
column4: Graduated from high school in a class of 31. Name misspelled in yearbook.

column3: Joined Army Reserves, basic training at Fort Dix, N.J.
column4: Joined Army Reserves, basic training at Fort Dix, N.J.

column3: First sexual encounter- ended up in hotel room with prostitutes; Fort Know, KY, more encounters with prostitutes
column4: First sexual encounter- ended up in hotel room with prostitutes; Fort Know, KY, more encounters with prostitutes

column3: Returned to Iowa, worked in Bakery; in Army Reserve Military Police; Drill Instructor for Junior Police
column4: Returned to Iowa, worked in Bakery; in Army Reserve Military Police; Drill Instructor for Junior Police

column4: Married first wife

column3: Volunteer Fireman; set fire/arson to school bus garage with friend-sentenced to 3 years, only served 20 months
column4: Volunteer Fireman; set fire/arson to school bus garage with friend-sentenced to 3 years, only served 20 months

column3: First wife divorced him
column4: First wife divorced him

column3: Met and married second wife
column4: Met and married second wife

column3: Moved to Alaska
column4: Moved to Alaska

column3: Had animals entered into Pope & Young's trophy hunting world-record books
column4: Had animals entered into Pope & Young's trophy hunting world-record books

column3: Megan Emerick (WF, 17) disappears from Anchorage, AK.  Hansen is later considered a suspect.
Mary K. Thill (WF, 23) disappears from Seward, AK.  Hansen is later considered a suspect.
Arrested for stealing a chainsaw- sentenced to 5 years, only served 1

Body of “Eklutna Annie” (a girl killed by Hansen whose body investigators have never been able to identify, due to the state of decomposition) was found near the Eklutna Road, body of Joanne Messina found in a gravel pit in the same area later that year
Roxanne Easlund (WF, 24) is last seen in Anchorage.
Joanne Messina is last seen in Seward.
Lisa Futrell (WF, 41) is last seen in Anchorage.

Opened a bakery using the money he received from a false insurance claim (said his home was robbed, later the “missing” hunting trophies were found in his backyard; Hansen said he forgot to report the recovery)
Andrea Altiery (WF, 22) is last seen in Anchorage.
Sherry Morrow (WF, 23) is last seen in Anchorage.
Bought Piper Super Cub N3089Z- never got his pilot’s license though. This was the plane he used for transporting victims to his remote cabin on the Knik River
Sue Luna (AF, 23) is last seen in Anchorage.
Off-duty police officers were hunting along the Knik River, found Sherry Morrow’s body
Paula Golding (WF, 17) is last seen in Anchorage.

Potential victim escaped from Hansen, ran to the road and waved down a trucker; the trucker went to police station and told them what happened, police and victim went to airport, victim identified Hansen’s plane. Police went to Hansen’s house; he denied the story and his alibi checked out.
Found Paula Goluding’s body

Investigators followed Hansen to work and asked him to come with them to the police station for questioning. Hansen never bothered to ask why they wanted to talk to him and agreed to go along. At the same time, two groups of investigators served warrants on Hansen's house and plane. Found weapons throughout the house, but nothing to implicate Hansen in any of the murders. Right before they were calling it a day, one of the officers discovered a hidden space tucked away in the attic rafters. 
In there, they discovered a Remington 552 rifle; a Thompson contender 7-mm single-shot pistol; an aviation map, with specific locations marked off; various pieces of jewelry; newspaper clippings; a Winchester 12-gauge shotgun; a driver's license, and various ID cards, some of which belonged to the dead women. As incriminating as these items were, the most important piece of evidence was found last -- a .223-caliber Mini-14 rifle

Anchorage grand jury returned four indictments against Hansen: first-degree assault and kidnapping, five counts of misconduct in possession of a handgun, theft in the second-degree, and theft by deception in insurance fraud
Ballistics test results came back; determined that the shell casings found at the gravesites had all been fired from Hansen's rifle
Hansen pled guilty to 4 counts of first-degree murder in the cases of Paula Goodling, Joanna Messina, Sherry Morrow, and "Eklutna Annie"

Hansen had his defense attorney, Fred Dewey, arranged a meeting with Anchorage D. A. Victor Krumm. During the meeting, Krumm offered Hansen a deal. In exchange for a full confession, the D.A. guaranteed him that he would only be charged with the four cases that they knew of, and he would be able to serve his time in a federal facility, rather than a maximum-security institution. Hansen reluctantly agreed to the conditions
Hansen sentenced to 461 years plus life, without chance of parole. He was then
remanded to Lewisburg Federal Penitentiary in Pennsylvania
column4: remanded to Lewisburg Federal Penitentiary in Pennsylvania

column3: Investigators found Sue Luna’s body - Knik River. Found Malai Larsen’s body - parking area by old Knik bridge
column4: Investigators found Sue Luna’s body - Knik River. Found Malai Larsen’s body - parking area by old Knik bridge

column4: Investigators found Teresa Watson’s body - Kenai Peninsula. Found Angela Feddern’s body - Figure Eight Lake

column3: Investigators found Tamara Pederson’s body - one and a half miles from old Knik Bridge
column4: Investigators found Tamara Pederson’s body - one and a half miles from old Knik Bridge

column3: Investigators found Lisa Futrell's body - south of old Knik Bridge
column4: Investigators found Lisa Futrell's body - south of old Knik Bridge

column3: Returned to Alaska and became one of the first inmates in the new Spring Creek Correctional Center in Seward, where he remains today
column4: Returned to Alaska and became one of the first inmates in the new Spring Creek Correctional Center in Seward, where he remains today

column3: Second wife filed for divorce and left Alaska for good, due to harassment
column4: Second wife filed for divorce and left Alaska for good, due to harassment

column3: More than 20 years after her decomposed body was found, Alaska State Troopers asked for the public's help in identifying "Eklutna Annie." In an effort to help solve her identity, state police released information regarding her clothing and jewelry
column4: More than 20 years after her decomposed body was found, Alaska State Troopers asked for the public's help in identifying "Eklutna Annie." In an effort to help solve her identity, state police released information regarding her clothing and jewelry
